content: everyday cotton washcloth by purlanna knitted washcloths are one of my comfort knits it s the project i go to when i need to keep my hands busy and my mind calm plus they are quick useful in your home and make great gifts this is the traditional knitted washcloth that a neighbor taught me when i was about twelve years old the pattern has been around forever and i don t know where it came from and i don t claim it as my own i just wanted to write it down and share it you will need a skein of 100% cotton worsted weight yarn and a us size 7 or 8 knitting needle you can use single points or a circular the washcloth is worked in garter stitch knit every row from corner to corner pattern co 4 row 1 kfb k2 kfb 6sts row 2 knit increase row k2 yo knit to end repeat increase row 49 more times until you have 56sts decrease row k1 k2tog yo k2tog knit to end repeat decrease row 49 more times until 6sts remain next row k1 k2tog twice k1 bobble remaining 4 sts and weave in loose ends abbreviations bobble = bind off co = cast on k = knit kfb = knit front and back of stitch k2tog = knit two stitches together st s = stitch es yo = yarn over ©purlanna knits 2024
